description: Tomato is a popular fruit/vegetable known for its versatility in cooking and its rich nutritional content.
spacing: 18 to 24 inches (45 to 60 cm) between plants, 24 to 36 inches (60 to 90 cm) between rows

nutrient_requirements: High in nitrogen, moderate in phosphorus and potassium
Additional micronutrients may be required based on soil test

common_pests.description: Large green caterpillars that feed on tomato leaves and fruits
common_pests.prevention_methods: Handpicking and destroying larvae, attracting natural predators like parasitic wasps

common_pests.description: Small white insects that suck sap from tomato plants, causing yellowing and wilting
common_pests.prevention_methods: Use of reflective mulches, introducing natural predators like ladybugs

common_diseases.description: Fungal disease causing brown spots on leaves and stem, leading to defoliation
common_diseases.prevention_methods: Crop rotation, use of disease-resistant varieties, proper sanitation
common_diseases.control_methods: Fungicides containing chlorothalonil or copper-based fungicides

common_diseases.description: Fungal disease causing dark lesions on leaves and fruits, leading to plant death
common_diseases.prevention_methods: Avoiding overhead watering, proper spacing for air circulation
common_diseases.control_methods: Fungicides containing mancozeb or copper-based fungicides

other_notes: Support tomato plants with stakes or cages to prevent fruit from touching the ground and reduce disease risk.

description: Potato is a starchy tuberous crop widely cultivated for its edible underground tubers.
spacing: 12 to 15 inches (30 to 38 cm) between plants, 30 inches (76 cm) between rows

nutrient_requirements: Moderate nitrogen, high phosphorus and potassium
Additional micronutrients may be required based on soil test

common_pests.description: Striped beetles that feed on potato foliage, causing defoliation
common_pests.prevention_methods: Handpicking and destroying larvae, crop rotation

common_pests.description: Yellow-brown larvae that bore into potato tubers, causing damage
common_pests.prevention_methods: Crop rotation, planting traps crops like mustard

common_diseases.description: Fungal disease causing dark lesions on leaves and tubers, leading to plant death
common_diseases.prevention_methods: Proper spacing for air circulation, avoiding overhead watering
common_diseases.control_methods: Fungicides containing mancozeb or copper-based fungicides

common_diseases.description: Fungal disease causing brown spots on leaves and stem, leading to defoliation
common_diseases.prevention_methods: Crop rotation, use of disease-resistant varieties, proper sanitation
common_diseases.control_methods: Fungicides containing chlorothalonil or copper-based fungicides

other_notes: Hilling soil around potato plants helps prevent tubers from being exposed to sunlight, reducing greening.
